posts.post_content:
[Mayor of Avabruck](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mayor of Avabruck) gets the job done on turn 6.  
  
T1: Land. Go.  
T2: Land. Cast [Mayor of Avabruck](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mayor of Avabruck)  
T3: Transform to [Howlpack Alpha](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Howlpack Alpha), swing for 3, and get a 3/3 wolf token.  
T4: Swing for 6, and get a 3/3 wolf token.  
T5: Swing for 9, and get a 3/3 wolf token.  
T6: Swing for the win.  
  
[Geist of Saint Traft](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Geist of Saint Traft) and [Stromkirk Noble](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stromkirk Noble) win on turn 7. I'm sure there a bunch of others in Innistrad as well what with all of the transformations. New Phyrexia probably has a lot as well with the Infect mechanic.
posts.html:
Mayor of Avabruck gets the job done on turn 6.

T1: Land. Go.
T2: Land. Cast Mayor of Avabruck
T3: Transform to Howlpack Alpha, swing for 3, and get a 3/3 wolf token.
T4: Swing for 6, and get a 3/3 wolf token.
T5: Swing for 9, and get a 3/3 wolf token.
T6: Swing for the win.

Geist of Saint Traft and Stromkirk Noble win on turn 7. I'm sure there a bunch of others in Innistrad as well what with all of the transformations. New Phyrexia probably has a lot as well with the Infect mechanic.

Posted By: SirZapdos (10/27/2011 11:32:09 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
if you count commander cards, [Ruhan of the Fomori](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ruhan of the Fomori) gets the job done turn 7  
also [desecration elemental](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=desecration elemental) works nicely turn 7  
if you can discard, which you probably can, [avatar of discord](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=avatar of discord) t7  
[drinker of sorrow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=drinker of sorrow) t7  
[mijae djinn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=mijae djinn) t7 if you win the flips  
[phylactery lich](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=phylactery lich) t7 if you're allowed artifact lands  
the classic [phyrexian negator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=phyrexian negator) t7  
[ruinous minotaur](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=ruinous minotaur) t7  
[phyrexian vatmother](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=phyrexian vatmother) t7  
[viashino sandstalker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=viashino sandstalker) t7  
[viashino cutthroat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=viashino cutthroat) t7  
[pardic dragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=pardic dragon) can t6 w/ firebreathing and the suspend  
[tempting wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=tempting wurm) can t6  
if you have three others in hand, [Tarox Bladewing](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tarox Bladewing) can t5  
and since you are playing a goldfish who doesn't know how to play magic and block, [hunted horror](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=hunted horror) does it turn 5

Posted By: pedrodyl (9/1/2011 11:59:30 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
[Flesh Reaver](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Flesh Reaver) is turn 7.  
So is [Maro](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Maro).  
[Wild Nacatl](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wild Nacatl) hits for 2 then 3s and gets there on t7. [Rogue Elephant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rogue Elephant) does 1 point of overkill damage as does [Scythe Tiger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Scythe Tiger).  
[Dandân](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dandân) is t7  
[Primordial Hydra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Primordial Hydra) t7 (4-2, 5-4, 6-8, 7-16)  
[Old Fogey](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Old Fogey) is t8...  
[Adamaro](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Adamaro) is t6  
For an 8 year old kid who is 10 feet tall, [Avatar of Me](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Avatar of Me) will kill on t6  
[Coiling Woodworm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Coiling Woodworm) is really fast if everyone drops forests. t6  
7 zombies in hand? [Ghastly Remains](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ghastly Remains) works for you on turn 6  
Suck at magic? [Gus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gus) is a turn 4.  
[Jumbo Imp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jumbo Imp) can turn 5 with luck.  
[Molten Sentry](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Molten Sentry) can turn 7.  
[Skyshroud War beast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Skyshroud War beast) can attack for 4, 5, 6, then 7 on turn 6 on the draw against nonbasic lands.

Skyshroud War beast can attack for 4, 5, 6, then 7 on turn 6 on the draw against nonbasic lands.

posts.post_content:
A riddle:  
You are playing a goldfish, on each turn you play a basic land, you may cast one creature in total, and cannot use the land for anything other than casting the creature. What is the fastest that you can kill your opponent?   
This kills your opponent turn 7, as can [Lost Leonin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lost Leonin) and [Slith Firewalker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Slith Firewalker). Is anything faster than turn 7? There are at least three shades that can do it by turn 6 if you allow use of the land. But is there another way to get under 7?
posts.html:
A riddle:
You are playing a goldfish, on each turn you play a basic land, you may cast one creature in total, and cannot use the land for anything other than casting the creature. What is the fastest that you can kill your opponent?
This kills your opponent turn 7, as can Lost Leonin and Slith Firewalker. Is anything faster than turn 7? There are at least three shades that can do it by turn 6 if you allow use of the land. But is there another way to get under 7?
Report Abuse  
Posted By: kiseki (9/1/2011 3:43:54 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Although [Thallid](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thallid) won't win when they are at 20, if they are at 22 then its the fastest 'single' creature killer at CMC 1. And he gets better than Woolly if you the target is at higher healths.  
  
Assuming your health could be anything, then [Death's Shadow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Death's Shadow) is a turn 2 or 3 win (depending if you allow for -health for any reason) but I assume you are at 20 as well.  
  
[Leveler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Leveler) is a turn 7 win if not being able to draw doesn't make you lose.  
  
[Etched Monstrosity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Etched Monstrosity) is turn 7 since you could remove its counters next turn before you attack.  
  
[Greater Gargadon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Greater Gargadon) is kinda close, since you could sac the lands and get it to kill 8.  
  
[Boldwyr Heavyweights](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boldwyr Heavyweights) is turn 7 since your opponent doesn't have creatures. Same with [Desecration Elemental](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Desecration Elemental).  
  
[Thunderblust](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thunderblust) is turn 7 thanks to Haste.  
  
Does he have cards? Turn 6 with [Nyxathid](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nyxathid)  
  
... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Although Thallid won't win when they are at 20, if they are at 22 then its the fastest 'single' creature killer at CMC 1. And he gets better than Woolly if you the target is at higher healths.

Assuming your health could be anything, then Death's Shadow is a turn 2 or 3 win (depending if you allow for -health for any reason) but I assume you are at 20 as well.

Leveler is a turn 7 win if not being able to draw doesn't make you lose.

Etched Monstrosity is turn 7 since you could remove its counters next turn before you attack.

Greater Gargadon is kinda close, since you could sac the lands and get it to kill 8.

Boldwyr Heavyweights is turn 7 since your opponent doesn't have creatures. Same with Desecration Elemental.

Thunderblust is turn 7 thanks to Haste.

Does he have cards? Turn 6 with Nyxathid

... (see all)
